description: Demolition of existing extension and erection of a 2 storey side/rear extension with a flat roof incorporating roof lights/windows and bifolding doors.
decision_conditions: The proposed two storey side/rear extension by reason of its poor design which includes; the absence of a 1.0m set in from the east boundary; the absence of a 0.5m dropped roofline and the use of an unsympathetic roof design; would be a disproportionate addition and would visually erode the separation gap between properties. It is considered the proposal would be indicative of an insensitive form of terrace development which would be at odds with the character and appearance of the application dwelling and the streetscene of Clayton Road. The proposal would be contrary to Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames LDF Core Strategy (Adopted April 2012), and the Residential Design SPD (Adopted July 2013).

The site comprises a semi-detached dwelling.Six neighbouring properties have been notified and no representations have been received.The key areas of assessment are:- The design of the proposed development; and,- The impact of the development on the amenities of existing and future occupants of land and buildings.When read together Policies CS8 and DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) require proposals to be of a high quality design that respects the character and appearance of the original building and the prevailing character of the surrounding area. Officer Comment: The proposed development is considered to be acceptable in terms of scale, form, bulk, height, massing, spacing and design. It is considered that there would be no adverse impacts on the character or appearance of the area as a result of the proposed development.Policy DM10 of the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Local Development Framework Core Strategy (CS)(2012) and the guidance in the Royal Borough of Kingston upon Thames Residential Design Guide SPD (2013) requires proposal to have regard to the amenities of the future occupants of the development as well as those of the existing occupants of neighbouring land and buildings, including in terms of privacy, outlook, sunlight/daylight, avoidance of visual intrusion and noise and disturbance.Officer Comment:  It is considered that the proposed development would not adversely affect the amenities of the occupiers of neighbouring properties by reason of overbearing appearance, loss of light or loss of privacy.In conclusion, the proposed development would be in general accordance with the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), the National Planning Practice Guidance, the London Plan, Policies of the Core Strategy (2012) and the Residential Design SPD (2013).

This form can be downloaded from the planning portal at https://ecab.planningportal.co.uk/uploads/1app/forms/form_1_cil_additional_information.pdf . Please complete and return as soon as possible. If you have confirmed that the development is Cil Liable, please also complete the Assumption of Liability Form at https://www.planningportal.co.uk/info/200136/policy_and_legislation/70/community_infrastructure_levy/5  and return as soon as possible.
